title: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008
text: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008 database Chinese surnames Chinese given names (1930-2008). database contains nationwide frequency statistics 1,806 Chinese surnames 2,614 Chinese characters used given names, covering 1.2 billion Han Chinese population (96.8% Han Chinese household-registered population born 1930 2008 still alive 2008). package also contains function computing multiple features Chinese surnames Chinese given names scientific research (e.g., name uniqueness, name gender, name valence, name warmth/competence).

title: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008
text: Chinese name database provided Beijing Meiming Science Technology Company (collaboration) originally obtained National Citizen Identity Information Center (NCIIC) China 2008. contains nationwide frequency statistics almost Chinese surnames given-name characters, covered 1.2 billion Han Chinese population (96.8% Han Chinese population born 1930 2008 still alive 2008, .e., living household-registered population). also contains subjective rating indices given-name characters. knowledge, comprehensive accurate Chinese name database now. Note database contain individual-level information (leak personal privacy). data name level character level. Extremely rare characters included. Neither Company information Chinese people. Year-level county-level data accessible. data provide compiled package.

title: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008
text: package includes five datasets (data.frame R). can access using data() function R. use datasets follow GNU GPL-3 License Creative Commons License CC -NC-SA, proper citation package non-commercial purposes. familyname: 1,806 Chinese surnames frequencies Han Chinese population. overall frequencies proportions, regardless gender birth cohort givenname: 2,614 Chinese characters given names frequencies Han Chinese population. separate frequencies proportions gender 6 birth cohorts (pre-1960s, 1960-1969, 1970-1979, 1980-1989, 1990-1999, 2000-2008) including usage single-character multi-character given names (e.g., character “伟” “张伟”, “张伟__”, “张__伟”, “王伟”, “王伟__”, “王__伟”, …) top1000name.prov: Top 1,000 given names 31 Chinese mainland provinces. top100name.year: Top 100 given names 6 birth cohorts. top50char.year: Top 50 given-name characters 6 birth cohorts. Note. “ppm” variable names datasets means “parts per million (百万分率)” (e.g., 1 ppm = proportion 1/106).

title: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008
text: Use compute_name_index() function. function computes multiple indices Chinese surnames given names scientific research. Just input data frame full names (birth years, necessary), returns new data frame name indices appended. Examples: NLen: full-name length 2~4 Chinese surname usually consists one character (.e., single surname, 单姓) sometimes consists two characters (.e., compound surname, 复姓). Chinese given name can single character combination two characters (rarely three characters, like author’s given name “Han-Wu-Shuang”). SNU: surname uniqueness 1~6 SNU = –log10(Psurname + 10–6) Psurname = percentage surname held people Han Chinese population. small constant (10–6) added adjust skewness limit maximum SNU 6.00. SNU = 2 3 mean 1/100 1/1000 people surname, respectively. diversity surnames limited China: top 25 common Chinese surnames covered 60% (0.7 billion) Han Chinese population (1.2 billion). SNI: surname initial (alphabetical order) 1~26 Chinese names usually sorted surname initials. index alphabetical order Pinyin initial surname. NU: name-character uniqueness (naming practices) 1~6 NU = –log10(Pcharacter + 10–6) Pcharacter = percentage character used single-character multi-character given names Han Chinese population within specific birth year (approximate estimate using nearest two birth cohorts relative weights, precise just using single birth cohort). small constant (10–6) added adjust skewness limit maximum NU 6.00. NU = 2 3 mean 1/100 1/1000 people used character given name (birth year), respectively. data without birth-year information, compute_name_index() function returns NU based average percentage across six birth cohorts. CCU: character-corpus uniqueness (contemporary Chinese corpus) 1~6 CCU = –log10(Pcharacter + 10–6) Pcharacter = percentage character contemporary Chinese corpus. CCU distinguished NU daily language usage distinct naming practices. characters rarely used personal names may instead frequently used daily language (vice versa). NG: name gender (difference proportions character used male vs. female) –1~1 NG = (Nmale – Nfemale) / (Nmale + Nfemale) NG ranges –1 (completely feminine; 100% used female) 0 (gender-neutral; half female half male) 1 (completely masculine; 100% used male). NV: name valence (positivity character meaning) 1~5 Subjective ratings 16 Chinese raters (9 males 7 females; interrater reliability ICC = 0.921) positivity 2,614 given-name characters according meaning character (1 = strongly negative, 3 = neutral, 5 = strongly positive). NW: name warmth/morality 1~5 Subjective ratings 10 Chinese raters (5 males 5 females; interrater reliability ICC = 0.774) person whose name contains 2,614 given-name characters likely warmth-related traits (1 = strongly unlikely , 3 = medium likelihood, 5 = strongly likely ). NC: name competence/assertiveness 1~5 Subjective ratings 10 Chinese raters (5 males 5 females; interrater reliability ICC = 0.712) person whose name contains 2,614 given-name characters likely competence-related traits (1 = strongly unlikely , 3 = medium likelihood, 5 = strongly likely ). * Instruction rating task NW NC (adapted Newman et al., 2018): According psychological research, people form impressions others, usually evaluate two aspects: warmth competence. “Warmth” (温暖) includes traits warm (热情), friendly (友好), righteous (正直), honest (诚实), kind (和善), fair (公平), sincere (真诚), reliable (可靠), moral (有道德). “Competence” (能力) includes traits competent (能干), clever (聪明), careful (细心), efficient (高效), creative (创新), ingenious (灵巧), knowledgeable (博学), persistent (坚韧), intelligent (有智慧). Imagine meet person whose given name contains following characters. Please judge likely /traits related “warmth” (“competence”). feel uncertain, please use intuition make best guess.

title: Chinese Name Database 1930-2008
text: Chinese given name multiple characters, name indices averaged across characters. words, name indices computed based characters rather character combinations. main reasons. Computing name variables character level practical research. Indeed, character combinations countless, whereas single characters finite set easy handle. Moreover, name indices NU, feasible approach, especially large sample. impractical ask participants rate millions billions character combinations. evidenced research, NU computed averaging across characters (objective NU) positively correlated people’s perception uniqueness given names (subjective NU): r = 0.32, p < 0.001, N = 672. evidenced research, among four measures name uniqueness (two character level two character-combination level), name-character uniqueness (.e., NU) positively associated cultural-level individualism. linguistics, name (word) English name character (single character) Chinese.

what: Compute multiple features of surnames and given names. — compute_name_index
title: Compute multiple features of surnames and given names. — compute_name_index
text: Compute available name features (indices) based familyname givenname. can either input data frame variable Chinese full names (variable birth years, necessary) just input vector full names (vector birth years, necessary). Usage 1: Input single value vector name [birth, necessary]. Usage 2: Input data frame data   variable name   var.fullname (var.surname /var.givenname)   [var.birthyear, necessary]. Caution. Name-character uniqueness (NU) birth year >= 2010 estimated forecasting thereby may accurate.

title: Compute multiple features of surnames and given names. — compute_name_index
code: compute_name_index(   data = NULL,   var.fullname = NULL,   var.surname = NULL,   var.givenname = NULL,   var.birthyear = NULL,   name = NA,   birth = NA,   index = c("NLen", "SNU", "SNI", "NU", "CCU", "NG", "NV", "NW", "NC"),   NU.approx = TRUE,   digits = 4,   return.namechar = TRUE,   return.all = FALSE )

title: Compute multiple features of surnames and given names. — compute_name_index
text: data Data frame. var.fullname Variable name Chinese full names (e.g., "name"). var.surname Variable name Chinese surnames (e.g., "surname"). var.givenname Variable name Chinese given names (e.g., "givenname"). var.birthyear Variable name birth year (e.g., "birth"). name data, can just input vector full name(s). birth data, can just input vector birth year(s). index indices compute? default, computes available name indices: NLen: full-name length (2~4). SNU: surname uniqueness (1~6). SNI: surname initial (1~26). NU: name-character uniqueness (1~6). CCU: character-corpus uniqueness (1~6). NG: name gender (-1~1). NV: name valence (1~5). NW: name warmth (1~5). NC: name competence (1~5). details, see https://psychbruce.github.io/ChineseNames/ NU.approx Whether approximately compute name-character uniqueness (NU) using nearest two birth cohorts relative weights (precise just using single birth cohort). Default TRUE. digits Number decimal places. Default 4. return.namechar Whether return separate name characters. Default TRUE. return.Whether return temporary variables computation final variables. Default FALSE.

title: Compute multiple features of surnames and given names. — compute_name_index
text: new data frame (class data.table) name indices appended. Full names split name0 (surnames, compound surnames automatically detected), name1, name2, name3 (given-name characters).
